result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier Cardan Buchanan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges and DNA surcharge.  DOC to collect from 25% of prison account under 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with victim AF dob 5/12/2000.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; his voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xavier Cardan Buchanan in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Akesha F.
 The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 66 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 48 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.    Restitution set at ZERO. 
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges and DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
-No contact with victim, AF, dob 5-12-2000.
-Register as a sex offender.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
ORDER FOR HIV testing signed by the Court.
Notice of RIght to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment filed.
Findings and Order with Respect to HIV Testing, signed and filed.
State's Motion for Testing of the Defendant for HIV Infection
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Xavier Cardan Buchanan in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   Same conditions of bail and release to remain.
Parties waive a PSI report.  Case is adjourned to 6-3-2014 at 8:15am for sentencing
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Xavier Cardan Buchanan in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has made a counter-proposal to the state which is not acceptable to the victim's mother.  Court will set matter for trial; parties may continue to negotiate resolution but it is to be completed PRIOR to the trial date of 5-14-2014.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Xavier Cardan Buchanan in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are requesting a brief adjournment for plea as the state needs to obtain input from the victim's family.  Case adjourned to 4-4-2014 at 8:15a.m. in Branch 38 for GUILTY PLEA. ls

Defendant Xavier Cardan Buchanan in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Erin Karshan for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case adjourned to 3-28-2014 at 8:15a.m. in Branch 38 for GUILTY PLEA. ls

Defendant Xavier Cardan Buchanan in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Paul Tiffin for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/20/14.
css

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AF, HER RESIDENCE, SCHOOL OR FAMILY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Xavier Cardan Buchanan in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Xavier Cardan Buchanan in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WAGNER, Branch 38.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
